meanings.sent1: As the sun set, the room started to grayout.
meanings.sent2: The screen slowly began to grayout as the battery died.
meanings.sent3: The light bulb decided to grayout right when I needed it the most.
meanings.sent4: Her memory of the event started to grayout like an old photograph.
meanings.sent5: The colors of the painting started to grayout, losing their vibrancy.

meanings.definition: A temporary loss of vision or consciousness
meanings.sent1: After the accident, he experienced a sudden grayout.
meanings.sent2: She felt a grayout coming on and quickly sat down.
meanings.sent3: The grayout lasted only a few seconds, but it felt much longer.
meanings.sent4: The grayout was like a brief pause in the movie of his life.
meanings.sent5: During the grayout, everything seemed to fade away into darkness.

meanings.definition: A state of partial or temporary inactivity or suspension
meanings.sent1: The project went into a grayout due to lack of funding.
meanings.sent2: During the storm, the city was in a grayout, with most activities suspended.
meanings.sent3: The grayout of the computer system caused delays in the office.
meanings.sent4: The grayout of the traffic lights led to chaos on the streets.
meanings.sent5: The grayout of the factory resulted in a temporary shutdown of production.
